citation.article-title: Robiginitalea myxolifaciens sp. nov., a novel myxol-producing bacterium isolated from marine sediment, and emended description of the genus Robiginitalea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Robiginitalea Cho & Giovannoni 2004
The description of the genus is as given by Cho & Giovannoni (2004), with the following amendments.
MK-6 is the only respiratory quinone.
The predominant fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 1ω10c, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content is 50–56 mol%.
